title: snowdown patch performance
body:
so with the snowdown patch i have terrible performance
before (on 7.24) i'd have around 100 fps consistently, but after this snowdown update even with the snowdown map disabled i end up having around 60 fps but with terrible stuttering making it feel closer to 20fps.
the funny part of it is that it gradually gets worse with game time, in the first few min of the match i have my normal fps but after a few min it goes down a lot with me sitting at 40-50 fps during the lategame, mind you with a lot of stuttering so the 40-50 fps feels attrocious (more like 20 fps)
no issues with ping (stable 19 as always), i have experienced this same thing over 4 games so far. (capping framerate also had no effect, i'm playing with medium graphic settings)

honestly makes league unplayable for me, the game just feels terrible to play because of the stuttering.

replies.body: Hey, your game files might be struggling to render which can drop frames.  See if a repair or force patch via the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) might help here.  Let me know and hang in there!

Ok i think i found the cause of the "stuttering" i think it was screen tearing. at the end of the game i tried capping my framerate to 30 and ye my screen definitly didn't like that. so i enabled "wait for vertical sync" or whatever it's called and it seems like the "stuttering" stopped. (hard to tell i had no time to properly test since our nexus was dying)
so as for the "stuttering" that's caused by the terrible framerate i have this patch, turning on vertical sync might be the solution.
i'm also playing on a (msi) laptop btw
E: turning on vertical sync makes the game feel very laggy, so not a solution at all.

for clarification: the framerate i'm getting is still just unacceptably low
btw on first glance it doesn't seem like there's anything abnormal in my r3d logs compared to before the patch (seems to be roughly the same amount and type of random errors)
btw2 is it normal for the client to take up 1gb of ram while in game, seems like an awful lot. (not that it matters since closing the client doesn't affect these fps issues)

i just tried to full repair and play another game, sadly enough the game ended quickly so i couldn't see the lategame (post 30 min)
it doesn't seem to have fixed the issue. for example at 20 min just standing in base resulted in 70fps and i still dipped into 50fps when fights were going on on my screen. I'll try force patch, but testing this takes a while since i don't seem to be getting the issue in practice tool.

E: even with force patch i still have the issues :/
it does seem like the exact stuttering has diminished a little bit in most cases where i'm not in combat, but during combat it's still terrible.

This is the exact same for me. I usually play well above 100fps when snowdown launched I was fine for a day but when the small update happened in between games on 12/13/2017 I lost frames exactly as you described.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled. I have updated all drivers graphics included. and I have tried the repair tool. nothing seems to fix it.

The issue is the patch. I have taken graphics to low and res down too but it still has no impact on those skipping frames. I'm using an Alienware 15 laptop been playing league on it for years.


EDIT: Wait for vertical sync fixed the jumpiness I saw but it lowered my 100 plus frame to 60....its smooth tho and doable
